animation_utils¶

Functions¶

def heightAnimation()

def horizontalSlideAnimation()

def opacityAnimation()

def propertyAnimation()

def resizeAnimation()

def slideAnimation()

def verticalSlideAnimation()

def widthAnimation()

Description¶

Utility functions for animating Qt objects.

msTools.coreUI.qt.animation_utils.heightAnimation(widget, startHeight=0, endHeight=480, duration=200, interpolationType=PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type.OutQuad, finishCallback=None, play=True)¶

Animate the height of a Qt widget.

Parameters:
  • widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to animate.
  • startHeight (float, optional) – The height of widget when the animation starts. Defaults to 0.
  • endHeight (float, optional) – The height of widget when the animation ends. Defaults to 480.
  • duration (int, optional) – The duration of the animation in milliseconds. Defaults to 200.
  • interpolationType (PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type, optional) – The type of interpolation for the animation. Defaults to OutQuad.
  • finishCallback (callable [[], any], optional) – A callable to execute when the animation finishes. Defaults to None.
  • play (bool, optional) – Whether to play the animation. Defaults to True.
Returns:

PySide2.QtCore.QPropertyAnimation – The animation object used to animate widget.
msTools.coreUI.qt.animation_utils.horizontalSlideAnimation(target, startOffset=-100, endOffset=0, duration=200, interpolationType=None, finishCallback=None, play=True)¶

Animate the local x-coordinate of a Qt widget or graphics item relative to its current position.

Parameters:
  • target (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget | T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem) – The widget or graphics item to animate.
  • startOffset (float, optional) – The local x-coordinate offset from the current position of target to be used when the animation starts. Defaults to -100.
  • endOffset (float, optional) – The local x-coordinate offset from the current position of target to be used when the animation ends. Defaults to 0.
  • duration (int, optional) – The duration of the animation in milliseconds. Defaults to 200.
  • interpolationType (PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type, optional) – The type of interpolation for the animation. Defaults to None - the interpolation type will be determined by the magnitude of the start and end offsets, either InQuad for decreasing displacement or OutQuad for increasing displacement.
  • finishCallback (callable [[], any], optional) – A callable to execute when the animation finishes. Defaults to None.
  • play (bool, optional) – Whether to play the animation. Defaults to True.
Returns:

PySide2.QtCore.QPropertyAnimation – The animation object used to animate target.
msTools.coreUI.qt.animation_utils.opacityAnimation(target, startValue=0.0, endValue=1.0, duration=200, interpolationType=None, finishCallback=None, play=True)¶

Animate the opacity of a Qt widget or graphics item.

Parameters:
  • target (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget | T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem) – The widget or graphics item to animate.
  • startValue (float, optional) – The opacity for target when the animation starts. Defaults to 0.0.
  • endValue (float, optional) – The opacity for target when the animation ends. Defaults to 1.0.
  • duration (int, optional) – The duration of the animation in milliseconds. Defaults to 200.
  • interpolationType (PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type, optional) – The type of interpolation for the animation. Defaults to None - the interpolation type will be determined by the direction of change in opacity, either InQuad for decreasing opacity or OutQuad for increasing opacity.
  • finishCallback (callable [[], any], optional) – A callable to execute when the animation finishes. Defaults to None.
  • play (bool, optional) – Whether to play the animation. Defaults to True.
Returns:

PySide2.QtCore.QPropertyAnimation – The animation object used to animate target.
msTools.coreUI.qt.animation_utils.propertyAnimation(target, propertyName, startValue, endValue, duration=200, interpolationType=PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type.OutQuad, finishCallback=None, play=True)¶

Animate a property of a Qt widget or graphics item.

Parameters:
  • target (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget | T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem) – The widget or graphics item to animate.
  • propertyName (basestring) – The name of a writable property on target. For a list of writable properties on target see msToolsUI.qt.inspect_utils.getWritablePropertiesFromObject(). For additional information on Qt properties see The Property System.
  • startValue (any) – The value for the property on target when the animation starts.
  • endValue (any) – The value for the property on target when the animation ends.
  • duration (int, optional) – The duration of the animation in milliseconds. Defaults to 200.
  • interpolationType (PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type, optional) – The type of interpolation for the animation. Defaults to OutQuad.
  • finishCallback (callable [[], any], optional) – A callable to execute when the animation finishes. Defaults to None.
  • play (bool, optional) – Whether to play the animation. Defaults to True.
Returns:

PySide2.QtCore.QPropertyAnimation – The animation object used to animate target.
msTools.coreUI.qt.animation_utils.resizeAnimation(widget, startSize=PySide2.QtCore.QSize(0, 0), endSize=PySide2.QtCore.QSize(400, 400), duration=200, interpolationType=PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type.OutQuad, finishCallback=None, play=True)¶

Animate the size of a Qt widget.

Parameters:
  • widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to animate.
  • startSize (float, optional) – The size of widget when the animation starts. Defaults to PySide2.QtCore.QSize(0, 0).
  • endSize (float, optional) – The size of widget when the animation ends. Defaults to PySide2.QtCore.QSize(400, 400).
  • duration (int, optional) – The duration of the animation in milliseconds. Defaults to 200.
  • interpolationType (PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type, optional) – The type of interpolation for the animation. Defaults to OutQuad.
  • finishCallback (callable [[], any], optional) – A callable to execute when the animation finishes. Defaults to None.
  • play (bool, optional) – Whether to play the animation. Defaults to True.
Returns:

PySide2.QtCore.QPropertyAnimation – The animation object used to animate widget.
msTools.coreUI.qt.animation_utils.slideAnimation(target, startVectorOffset=PySide2.QtCore.QPoint(-100, -100), endVectorOffset=PySide2.QtCore.QPoint(0, 0), duration=200, interpolationType=None, finishCallback=None, play=True)¶

Animate the local coordinates of a Qt widget or graphics item relative to its current position.

Parameters:
  • target (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget | T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem) – The widget or graphics item to animate.
  • startVectorOffset (PySide2.QtCore.QPoint | PySide2.QtCore.QPointF, optional) – The local coordinate offset from the current position of target to be used when the animation starts. If target is a PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget, the type must be a PySide2.QtCore.QPoint. Defaults to QtCore.QPoint(-100, -100).
  • endVectorOffset (PySide2.QtCore.QPoint | PySide2.QtCore.QPointF, optional) – The local coordinate offset from the current position of target to be used when the animation ends. If target is not a PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem, the type must be a PySide2.QtCore.QPoint. Defaults to QtCore.QPoint(0, 0).
  • duration (int, optional) – The duration of the animation in milliseconds. Defaults to 200.
  • interpolationType (PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type, optional) – The type of interpolation for the animation. Defaults to None - the interpolation type will be determined by the magnitude of the start and end offsets, either InQuad for decreasing displacement or OutQuad for increasing displacement.
  • finishCallback (callable [[], any], optional) – A callable to execute when the animation finishes. Defaults to None.
  • play (bool, optional) – Whether to play the animation. Defaults to True.
Raises:

TypeError – If target is a PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget and startVectorOffset or endVectorOffset is a PySide2.QtCore.QPointF.
Returns:

PySide2.QtCore.QPropertyAnimation – The animation object used to animate target.
msTools.coreUI.qt.animation_utils.verticalSlideAnimation(target, startOffset=-100, endOffset=0, duration=200, interpolationType=None, finishCallback=None, play=True)¶

Animate the local y-coordinate of a Qt widget or graphics item relative to its current position.

Parameters:
  • target (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget | T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem) – The widget or graphics item to animate.
  • startOffset (float, optional) – The local y-coordinate offset from the current position of target to be used when the animation starts. Defaults to -100.
  • endOffset (float, optional) – The local y-coordinate offset from the current position of target to be used when the animation ends. Defaults to 0.
  • duration (int, optional) – The duration of the animation in milliseconds. Defaults to 200.
  • interpolationType (PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type, optional) – The type of interpolation for the animation. Defaults to None - the interpolation type will be determined by the magnitude of the start and end offsets, either InQuad for decreasing displacement or OutQuad for increasing displacement.
  • finishCallback (callable [[], any], optional) – A callable to execute when the animation finishes. Defaults to None.
  • play (bool, optional) – Whether to play the animation. Defaults to True.
Returns:

PySide2.QtCore.QPropertyAnimation – The animation object used to animate target.
msTools.coreUI.qt.animation_utils.widthAnimation(widget, startWidth=0, endWidth=640, duration=200, interpolationType=PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type.OutQuad, finishCallback=None, play=True)¶

Animate the width of a Qt widget.

Parameters:
  • widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to animate.
  • startWidth (float, optional) – The width of widget when the animation starts. Defaults to 0.
  • endWidth (float, optional) – The width of widget when the animation ends. Defaults to 640.
  • duration (int, optional) – The duration of the animation in milliseconds. Defaults to 200.
  • interpolationType (PySide2.QtCore.QEasingCurve.Type, optional) – The type of interpolation for the animation. Defaults to OutQuad.
  • finishCallback (callable [[], any], optional) – A callable to execute when the animation finishes. Defaults to None.
  • play (bool, optional) – Whether to play the animation. Defaults to True.
Returns:

PySide2.QtCore.QPropertyAnimation – The animation object used to animate widget.
